transliteration:
itareṣv āgamād dharmaḥ pādaśas tvavaropitaḥ |
caurikānṛtamāyābhir dharmaś cāpai ti pādaśaḥ || 1.82||
sph_interpretive_translation: In other realms, Dharma is established by direct divine transmission; in this realm, it is upheld through the fourfold foundation. When alignment with truth, integrity, and non-deception falters, that very Dharma withdraws from manifestation.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates from divine cognition, not human consensus
Causation arises from alignment or misalignment with Sanatana Dharma
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by one's proximity to truth-consciousness
Restoration logic operates through reconnection to foundational Dharma
Consciousness alignment determines the sustainability of lawful order
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent demonstrates disalignment with truth-consciousness THEN Dharma-recognition within system shall diminish proportionally
IF agent restores alignment with foundational Dharma THEN recognition and capacity shall be automatically reinstated
IF societal structures fail to uphold non-deception THEN legal coherence shall self-reduce until realignment occurs
ALL adjudicative processes MUST prioritize consciousness-state verification over procedural form
NO law shall persist where foundational alignment has been abdicated by governing entities
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this principle mandates that constitutional validity hinges upon alignment with foundational Dharma rather than legislative majority. The threshold of responsibility rests on the degree of consciousness-integrity demonstrated by those executing authority. Judicial decisions must reflect restoration of Dharma-prevalence, not punitive correction.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that when rulers or institutions abandon truth-consciousness, Dharma naturally recedes. This withdrawal is neither punitive nor arbitrary—it follows the sequential unfolding (anupūrvaśaḥ) of causal dissonance. Responsibility is proportional to the extent of deviation from foundational alignment. There is no external punishment—only natural consequence of severed connection.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Truth-Reclamation Process for all involved parties
Reconnect agents with foundational Dharma through guided realization
Establish Integrity Circuits to monitor consciousness-alignment metrics
Deploy Completion Mechanisms for unresolved karmic patterns causing systemic distortion
Activate Reintegration Protocols upon demonstrable return to truth-consciousness
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma is restored as consciousness awakens. Reality remains non-punitive. All judgment resides ultimately in the Self-luminous Witness.
